Details: Police were called to reports of a man being attacked with a knife. Suspect and victim were on the ground when officers opened fire and killed them both.
A suspect was armed with a BB gun at SFO airport. The suspect lifted the BB gun towards officers, who shot and killed him.
A suspect at a residential hotel ran at officers with a knife. One officer fired "less-lethal" weapons and the other fired their gun. The suspect was killed.

Location: Jack London Alley and Brannan St.
Details: Plainclothes officers followed a group of auto burglary suspects. While attempting to detain one of the suspects, an officer shot them in the wrist.
Officers were called to break up a fight between two men. One man held a knife, and did not drop it when asked. Officers shot the suspect with "less-lethal" weapons and with guns; he was injured.
A suspect allegedly connected to a carjacking ran at two officers with a knife. Both officers shot and killed him.
A suspect found trespassing in a building was wielding a "wooden board." Among "multiple uses of force," an officers shot at the suspect, but they were not struck.

An off-duty officer intervened in a carjacking. The suspect attacked the officer with a knife. The officer shot and injured the suspect, who stole a police car and fled. He was later killed by South San Francisco PD.
A suspect hit an officer with a glass bottle; two officers shot and seriously injured him.
An off-duty officer shot at a car after a "traffic altercation." The other car left at high speed.
An off-duty officer confronted a "subject inside the gated area of a condo complex." The subject tried to hit the officer with a rock; the officer shot and injured him.
A suspect "acting in a suspicious manner" fled from officers. He took a handgun from his waistband; an officer shot him twice and injured him.

A suspect fled after a potential auto-burglary. The suspect got into a car and collided with several other vehicles as he tried to flee. A recruit officer shot at the car twice. There were no injuries and the suspect was later arrested.
Two officers tried to detain a suspect in a barber shop. The suspect shot one in the leg; the officers returned fire and killed him. Four bystanders were injured.
Trying to flee after an armed robbery, a suspect concealed himself in a car trunk. He shot at officers and ten returned fire, killing him.

Location: De Haro St. and Alameda St.
Details: A suspect wanted in connection to a homicide fired upon officers from within an RV. Seven officers returned fire. There were no injuries; the suspect was arrested.
An off-duty officer died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

A recruit officer and his training officer chased a suspect wanted in connection to a carjacking. The suspect stopped his vehicle, got out, and ran towards the officers' car. The recruit shot and killed the suspect.
Two officers interrupted an auto burglary. The suspect shot at both officers; one was injured. The other officer fired back and injured the suspect.
Officers shot and killed an armed suspect holding a woman and child hostage. There were no other injuries.
Officers say they saw a suspect stabbing a restaurant employee. The suspect, carrying a knife, chased the employee. An officer shot and killed the suspect.

A suspect was approached due to a reported restraining order violation. He allegedly resisted officers and injured one in a "physical struggle." Another officer shot him twice, injuring him. The suspect died three years later due to complications from his injuries.
An officer was shot and injured. The responding officers exchanged fire with the suspect, killing him.
A suspect in a stolen car tried to flee from police, "almost striking one of the officers, before heading toward" another. An officer shot and killed her.

The Homeless Outreach Team members called police regarding a man with a knife. The suspect moved towards officers brandishing the knife. After firing "less-lethal" rounds, officers shot and killed him.
The suspect of a stabbing was surrounded by officers while holding a knife. The suspect moved towards an officer; five officers shot and killed him.
A suspect took a rifle to the sixth floor of a construction site, and allegedly appeared to be "looking for potential targets." Three officers shot and killed him.
A suspect went on a "citywide rampage" ramming cars. An officer shot at him and missed on Treasure Island. The suspect was later apprehended.
A suspect assaulted an officer, grabbed the officer's pistol, and pointed it in his face. A second officer shot and killed him.
A suspect fled from the scene of a hit-and-run and tried to carjack several vehicles. The suspect "charged" at an officer; the officer shot and wounded him.

Location: Van Ness Ave. and Pine St.
Details: The driver of a stolen vehicle attempted to flee from officers, ramming vehicles and driving on the wrong side of the road. Officers shot and killed her.
A suspect assaulted an officer with a kitchen knife. Other officers shot and killed him.
A suspect broke into the Mission Police Station car park. The suspect drew a fake gun from his waistband; two officers shot and killed him.
Officers were called to a closed business when its alarm was tripped. Upon seeing a suspect inside, an officer shot at them and missed.
A suspect attempted to rob an off-duty officer. A struggle ensued; the officer shot and wounded the suspect.
Officers interrupted a drug deal. A suspect pointed a gun at an officer; the officer shot and wounded him.
Officers observed an auto burglary and followed the suspects to their car. One pointed a gun at an officer (who was not in uniform); the officer shot and killed him.

A car rolled over in a collision. When bystanders tried to render aid, they were fired upon from inside the car. The suspect ultimately emerged and pointed a gun at officers; six officers shot and killed him.
A suspect pointed a taser at officers. The officers shot and killed him.
A suspect steered a vehicle toward an officer. An officer fired at the suspect and missed. An officer was hit by gunfire; the suspect fled and was apprehended later.
A suspect rammed a number of vehicles with a stolen car, while officers tried to stop him. The suspect accelerated toward an officer. Another officer shot the car; the suspect was not hit and fled.
An off-duty officer was involved in a traffic collision. The other driver assaulted the officer. The officer shot and grazed him; he was then arrested.
A suspect drove their car in the direction of an officer; the officer fired once at the driver. The shot missed. The suspect later crashed the car and was arrested.
Officers responded to a robbery in progress. When a suspect drew a weapon, four officers shot and injured him.
A male suspect shot at two men. An officer fired at the suspect and missed. The suspect ran but was apprehended.

Officers were called to the scene of a machete assault. While officers spoke to the victim outside the residence, the suspect came out with a hammer raised above his head; an officer shot and killed him.
Officers were called to a fight, where a suspect held a gun threateningly. When he turned towards officers, an officer shot and injured him (and a bystander).
An off-duty officer accidentally shot himself in the leg while repairing his gun.
A suspect drove a carjacked taxi at police officers. One officer shot at the car; the driver was not struck. He was later arrested.
A suspect drove a carjacked vehicle down a dead-end. Officers fired at the car when it attempted a three-point turn, injuring the suspect.
A suspect drove a stolen car toward officers; an officer recruit fired three shots at the vehicle. There were no injuries.
A suspect pointed a machine-pistol at an officer; another officer shot him twice, injuring him.

Two suspects fled after being approached by an officer. One turned to the officer "holding an object the officer believed to be a firearm." The officer shot and missed; the suspect escaped over a fence.
A suspect fell during a pursuit, then pointed a pistol at an officer. The officer shot and injured him.
Officers were called to a stabbing. The suspect "thrust" a boxcutter at officers. An officer shot and killed the suspect.
Officers interrupted a robbery. The suspect drew a pistol; one officer fired at the suspect and missed. The suspect surrendered.
Officers attempted to interview a suspect in connection to a homicide. The suspect barricaded himself inside a building and fired upon the officers. An officer shot and killed him with a rifle.
Suspect drove into a carjacked vehicle into a police car. An officer shot the car, which crashed. The suspect was uninjured.
A suspect fled following a traffic stop. The suspect shot at officers, who fired back and killed him.
Two victims (included the suspect's father) were stabbed. An officer shot and killed the suspect. One of the stabbing victims died.
A suspect, armed with a pistol, fled from officers. A officer shot at the suspect and hit two bystanders. The suspect was arrested.
A suspect was detained in relation to MUNI fare evasion. The suspect fled â€“ and fired upon officers during the chase. The officers shot and killed the suspect.
Two officers tried to arrest a wanted parolee thought to have an assault rifle. When confronted, the suspect fired a handgun at the officers, who fired back. The suspect was struck and injured.
Officers saw a suspected bank robber in a parked stolen car. The suspect "used his vehicle as a weapon" as he pulled out. Two officers shot at the car and killed the suspect.
Officers were called to arrest a "mentally disturbed" suspect. The wheelchair-bound suspect was wielding a knife. One officer was stabbed; two opened fire and injured the suspect.
Officers responded to a report of a stabbing. Two officers were "confronted" by a suspect with a knife. The officers shot and killed them.
Officers confronted several individuals for violating "park regulations." One person "physically attacked" an officer; the officer shot and injured them.

When a car fled a traffic stop by plainclothes officers, one officer got caught and started to be dragged by the car. Another officer shot at the car. There were no injuries; the suspect turned himself in several days later.
An off-duty officer died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in Los Altos.
A suspect refused to leave his vehicle during a traffic stop. Narcotics were found and the suspect tried to drive away; an officer fired but there were no injuries.
An officer confronted the occupant of an apartment after a noise complaint. The occupant "gained possession of a firearm during the confrontation." The officer shot and killed them.
An off-duty officer was found dead in his home, with a single self-inflicted gunshot wound.
Plainclothes officers confronted several suspects. One fired a pistol at the officers, and the officers returned fire. No-one was hit; several suspects were arrested.
An officer pursued a car wanted in relation to a carjacking. She fired upon the suspects but missed; the suspects escaped.
Plainclothes officers saw someone fire a pistol into a crowd of people. They gave chase and fired upon him. They missed, but the suspect was arrested.
Plainclothes officers tried to investigate an occupied, parked car. The driver accelerated toward an officer; the officer shot at the driver, who fled.
A suspect fled a traffic stop, reversing into an unmarked police car. The officer shot and injured the driver.
An officer at the Mission Police Station accidentally shot himself in the hand while reassembling his gun.
An officer was confronted by "a suspect armed with a machete." The officer shot and killed the suspect.
An off-duty sergeant died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
A "mentally disturbed person" was breaking windows with a flashlight. The subject was also armed with a knife. An officer shot and injured them.

A suspect was threatening others with a cleaver, according to his landlord. Officers used "less-lethal" rounds but they proved ineffective. When the suspect "attacked officers with the cleaver," an officer shot and killed him.
An officer stopped a car for having an expired registration. The car drove away. The officer shot at the car; the suspect fled and was not captured.
Officers were assisting with crowd control after a shooting, when a suspect began firing a gun in the area. When he pointed his pistol at officers, the officers shot and injured him.
A suspect broke into an occupied house with a pry bar. When officers arrived, the suspect knocked one down the stairs. Another officer shot and injured the suspect.
A social worker called police to help with a "mentally disordered" individual. She "confronted the officers with a knife." Officers shot and injured her.
An off-duty officer shot and injured himself while holstering his weapon during a camping trip.

Location: Lombard St. and Van Ness Ave.
Details: An officer tried to take an "aggressive panhandler" into custody for outstanding warrants. The suspect fled and back-up arrived. The suspect produced a knife and "advanced on the officers." An officer shot and killed the suspect.
An off-duty officer unintentionally discharged his gun at his San Mateo home and died.

A suspect was trying to assault occupants of a parked vehicle with two kitchen knives. When officers intervened, the suspect "rapidly approached" them. The officers shot and killed the suspect (who was later found to have murdered someone a block away).
A restaurant manager called police to remove a "troublesome patron." While being detained, the suspect tried to fire a gun at the officers. Officers shot and killed the suspect.
Two officers pursued a suspect wanted for robbery and weapons offences. The suspect shot and killed an officer. The officers returned fire; the suspect shot and killed himself.
Officers responded to a call about a gun. A suspect approached them and raised a "gun" in their direction. One officer shot and killed him - and the gun turned out to be fake.
Officers responded to shots fired. A suspect shot at the officers; one officer shot and killed the suspect. Two murder victims were later found in a nearby car, presumed to be killed by the suspect.

Location: Capp St. between 15th St. and 16th St.
Details: Two officers approached a car that had been reported stolen and was allegedly being used for drug dealing. Both officers drew their guns; the driver started the car and pinned one. Both officers shot and killed the suspect.

Officers responded to a call about squatters in Park Merced Complex. A suspect was concealing himself in an attic. He made "threats and furtive movements." Officers incorrectly thought he had a gun; officers shot and killed him.
Officers followed a car after seeing a firearm. On Treasure Island, suspects in the vehicle did not surrender and instead drove at police. Officers shot and injured two suspects.
An off-duty officer returned to his car and found a suspect inside. The suspect met the officer with "resistance and furtive movement." The officer shot and wounded the suspect.

Officers tried to stop a vehicle, because of a report of firearms, but the car drove off. Occupants then fled on foot, and one passenger pointed a rifle at officers. Officers fired at and injured the passenger.
A suspect fled in his car when officers attempted to serve him a warrant. The suspect drove "directly at" an officer, who shot and wounded him.
An off-duty inspector died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound at his home.
Officers tried to detain a parolee in the passenger seat of a car. The car's driver attempted to flee, knocking an officer to the ground. Another officer shot and injured the driver.
An officer shot himself while getting out of his car. He was injured.
A man "matching the description" of a robbery suspect was approached by an officer. The suspect "displayed a knife in a threatening manner," after which the officer shot and wounded him.
A parolee pointed a gun at officers; the gun misfired. An officer shot and injured the parolee.
A felon (wanted in connection to a homicide) escaped during an attempted arrest. After a car pursuit, the suspect exchanged fire with officers, and was shot and killed.
A suspect attempted to kidnap a woman, then shot at police during a pursuit. Several officers shot and killed the suspect.
An officer fired on a suspect during a traffic stop. The suspect fled, injured, and was later arrested.
A dog was attacking a child. Officers shot at the dog several times, and a stray round struck and injured an officer.
After a short chase, a suspect driving a stolen vehicle attempted to run over a police officer. The officer shot and killed the driver.
A police sniper covering a mayoral event was shot in the hand while passing a weapon to a colleague.
An officer injured themselves by unintentionally firing their gun while leaving Lake Merced pistol range.
Officers responded to a call about a "mentally disturbed person." The suspect tried to stab the officers. The officers shot and injured the suspect.
A suspect crashed their car after a high-speed pursuit. The driver pinned an officer against a wall with their vehicle; the officer shot and killed them.
Officers tried to stop a car that had been driving recklessly. The driver pinned an officer with their car; officers then shot and killed the driver.
A suspect was threatening officers and bystanders with a knife. An officer shot and killed the suspect.
A suspect "almost ran down" a police officer while fleeing another police agency at the airport. The officer shot and injured the suspect.
An officer died from a self-inflicted gunshot.
During a traffic stop, a suspect shot an officer with a handgun. The officer shot and injured the suspect.
A suspect stabbed a police sergeant with a knife. Another officer shot and killed the suspect.
Police officers shot a suspect as he drove toward them. The suspect drove away, injured. The suspect was later arrested and taken to hospital.
A suspect stabbed someone and attacked officers with a knife. Officers shot and killed the suspect (and injured a bystander).
Various police departments were looking for a wanted fugitive. When he was confronted, there was a firefight. The officers shot and injured him.
An off-duty officer died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
An off-duty officer was punched and kicked severely by "an individual of superior strength and size." The officer shot and killed the assailant with a handgun.
